attributes.action: Keep leisure centres, swimming pools and gyms open during any lockdown.
attributes.additional_details: A recent Active Lives survey that showed nearly 14 million people did less than 30 minutes’ exercise a week during the first lockdown, a rise of three million compared with the same period a year before. With the onset of winter, the provision of safe facilities for physical activity will be vital. Closure will lead to a further deterioration in both physical and mental health levels across the country, with implications on longer term public health challenges.
attributes.background: Keep all indoor and outdoor sports facilities open during the November ‘20 (and any future) lockdown - recategorising these facilities as ‘essential services’.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
